Package controllers

Class AddPartController

java.lang.Object
controllers.AddPartController
public class AddPartController
extends java.lang.Object
This controller adds a part to the list of parts in the main controller. This covers error checking and adds to the inventory. Adds a part to the main parts list

  • Constructor Details

    • AddPartController

      public AddPartController​(Inventory inv)
      Constructor. Adds the inventory that was initialized from the main function. So that you can easily add parts
      Parameters:
      inv -

  • Method Details

    • changeProperty

      void changeProperty​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This is triggered on the mouse click. The change property is in charge of chaging whether a part is Outsourced or In house This allows a program to determine whether the part is in house and add a machine ID or outsourced and add a company name.
      Parameters:
      event - this is the radio button. it is toggled from "In House" and "Outsourced"

    • cancelPart

      void cancelPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Cancels part and returns to main menu on button press.
      Parameters:
      event - This is the cancel part button. Returns to main menu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This exception is from JavaFX. If the main screen fails to load, this is called.

    • savePart

      void savePart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Saves part when button is pressed and returns the user to the main menu. It adds the part into the inventory and can be seen in the main table.
      Parameters:
      event - this is the Save part button that initiates creating a part and returning to the main menu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an exception if part not saved
